table.style: border: 0px; font-size: 11px; font-family: verdana; vertical-align: top;

tr.style: border: 1px #F0F0F0 solid; font-size: 11px; font-family: verdana; vertical-align: top;
border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAEklEQVR42mP4//0/iYDhP8kAANZ3Y5Ucw2ZoAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: The header for a message exchange that is either requesting or responding to an action. The resource(s) that are the subject of the action as well as other Information related to the action are typically transmitted in a bundle in which the MessageHeader resource instance is the first resource in the bundle.

tr.td: A resource that describes a message that is exchanged between systems

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAEklEQVR42mP4//0/iYDhP8kAANZ3Y5Ucw2ZoAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: The identifier of this message.

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAEklEQVR42mP4//0/iYDhP8kAANZ3Y5Ucw2ZoAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: The time that the message was sent.

tr.td: Time that the message was sent

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAEklEQVR42mP4//0/iYDhP8kAANZ3Y5Ucw2ZoAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: Code that identifies the event this message represents and connects it with it's definition. Events defined as part of the FHIR specification have the system value "http://hl7.org/fhir/message-type".

tr.td:
Code for the event this message represents
MessageEvent (??)

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAEklEQVR42mP4/x0ISQIM/0kGANNnY41GtlCWAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: Information about the message that this message is a response to. Only present if this message is a response.

tr.td: If this is a reply to prior message

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAEklEQVR42mP4/x0ISQIM/0kGANNnY41GtlCWAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAEklEQVR42mP4/x0ISQIM/0kGANNnY41GtlCWAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: Code that identifies the type of response to the message - whether it was successful or not, and whether it should be resent or not.

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAEklEQVR42mP4//0/iYDhP8kAANZ3Y5Ucw2ZoAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: Full details of any issues found in the message.

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAEklEQVR42mP4/x0ISQIM/0kGANNnY41GtlCWAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: The source application from which this message originated.

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAEklEQVR42mP4/x0ISQIM/0kGANNnY41GtlCWAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: Human-readable name for the target system.

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAEklEQVR42mP4/x0ISQIM/0kGANNnY41GtlCWAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: May include configuration or other information useful in debugging.

tr.td: Name of software running the system

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAEklEQVR42mP4/x0ISQIM/0kGANNnY41GtlCWAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: Can convey versions of multiple systems in situations where a message passes through multiple hands.

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAEklEQVR42mP4/x0ISQIM/0kGANNnY41GtlCWAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: An e-mail, phone, website or other contact point to use to resolve issues with message communications.

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAEklEQVR42mP4//0/iYDhP8kAANZ3Y5Ucw2ZoAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: Identifies the routing target to send acknowledgements to.

tr.td: Actual message source address or id

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAEklEQVR42mP4/x0ISQIM/0kGANNnY41GtlCWAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: The destination application which the message is intended for.

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAEklEQVR42mP4/x0ISQIM/0kGANNnY41GtlCWAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: Human-readable name for the source system.

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAEklEQVR42mP4/x0ISQIM/0kGANNnY41GtlCWAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: Identifies the target end system in situations where the initial message transmission is to an intermediary system.

tr.td: Particular delivery destination within the destination

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAEklEQVR42mP4//0/iYDhP8kAANZ3Y5Ucw2ZoAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: Indicates where the message should be routed to.

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAEklEQVR42mP4//0/iYDhP8kAANZ3Y5Ucw2ZoAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: The person or device that performed the data entry leading to this message. Where there is more than one candidate, pick the most proximal to the message. Can provide other enterers in extensions.

tr.td: The source of the data entry

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAEklEQVR42mP4//0/iYDhP8kAANZ3Y5Ucw2ZoAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: The logical author of the message - the person or device that decided the described event should happen. Where there is more than one candidate, pick the most proximal to the MessageHeader. Can provide other authors in extensions.

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAEklEQVR42mP4//0/iYDhP8kAANZ3Y5Ucw2ZoAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: Allows data conveyed by a message to be addressed to a particular person or department when routing to a specific application isn't sufficient.

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAEklEQVR42mP4//0/iYDhP8kAANZ3Y5Ucw2ZoAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: The person or organization that accepts overall responsibility for the contents of the message. The implication is that the message event happened under the policies of the responsible party.

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAEklEQVR42mP4//0/iYDhP8kAANZ3Y5Ucw2ZoAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: Coded indication of the cause for the event - indicates a reason for the occurance of the event that is a focus of this message.

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAD0lEQVR42mP4TzJgIF0LANmXY523xFiMAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: The actual data of the message - a reference to the root/focus class of the event.

tr.td: The actual content of the message

purpose.value: This is the definition for the MessageHeader resource

short.value: A resource that describes a message that is exchanged between systems

formal.value: The header for a message exchange that is either requesting or responding to an action. The resource(s) that are the subject of the action as well as other Information related to the action are typically transmitted in a bundle in which the MessageHeader resource instance is the first resource in the bundle.

May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

comments.value: there can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions. The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core simplicity for everyone.

formal.value: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource, and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

comments.value: there can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions. The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core simplicity for everyone.

formal.value: The base language in which the resource is written.

comments.value:
Language is provided to support indexing and accessibility (typically, services such as text to speech use the language tag). The html language tag in the narrative applies to the narrative. The language tag on the resource may be used to specify the language of other presentations generated from the data in the resource
Not all the content has to be in the base language. The Resource.language should not be assumed to apply to the narrative automatically. If a language is specified, it should it also be specified on the div element in the html (see rules in HTML5 for information about the relationship between xml:lang and the html lang attribute).

short.value: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation

formal.value: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource, and may be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.

comments.value: Contained resources do not have narrative. Resources that are not contained SHOULD have a narrative.

formal.value: These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, and nor can they have their own independent transaction scope.

comments.value: This should never be done when the content can be identified properly, as once identification is lost, it is extremely difficult (and context dependent) to restore it again.

formal.value: The identifier of this message.

comments.value: This SHALL be unique within the scope of this stream of messages.

short.value: Time that the message was sent

formal.value: The time that the message was sent.

short.value: Code for the event this message represents

formal.value: Code that identifies the event this message represents and connects it with it's definition. Events defined as part of the FHIR specification have the system value "http://hl7.org/fhir/message-type".

description.value: One of the message events defined as part of FHIR

short.value: If this is a reply to prior message

formal.value: Information about the message that this message is a response to. Only present if this message is a response.

May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

comments.value: there can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions. The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core simplicity for everyone.

formal.value: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource, and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

comments.value: there can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions. The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core simplicity for everyone.

formal.value: The id of the message that this message is a response to.
Code that identifies the type of response to the message - whether it was successful or not, and whether it should be resent or not.

comments.value: This is a generic response to the request message. Specific data for the response will be found in MessageHeader.data.

description.value: The kind of response to a message

formal.value: Full details of any issues found in the message.

comments.value: This SHALL be contained in the bundle. If any of the issues are errors, the response code SHALL be an error.

formal.value: The source application from which this message originated.

May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

comments.value: there can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions. The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core simplicity for everyone.

formal.value: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource, and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

comments.value: there can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions. The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core simplicity for everyone.

formal.value: Human-readable name for the target system.

short.value: Name of software running the system

formal.value: May include configuration or other information useful in debugging.
Can convey versions of multiple systems in situations where a message passes through multiple hands.

map.value: SFT-2-software certified version or release number

formal.value: An e-mail, phone, website or other contact point to use to resolve issues with message communications.

map.value: unique(./entity[determinerCode="INST" and classCode="DEV"]/scopesRole[normalRole() and classCode="CON" and layer[classCode="PSN"]/telecom[isNormalDatatype()])

short.value: Actual message source address or id

formal.value: Identifies the routing target to send acknowledgements to.

comments.value: The id may be a non-resolvable URI for systems that do not use standard network-based addresses.

formal.value: The destination application which the message is intended for.

comments.value: there SHOULD be at least one destination, but in some circumstances, the source system is unaware of any particular destination system.

formal.value: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

comments.value: there can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions. The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core simplicity for everyone.

formal.value: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource, and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

comments.value: there can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions. The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core simplicity for everyone.

formal.value: Human-readable name for the source system.

short.value: Particular delivery destination within the destination

formal.value: Identifies the target end system in situations where the initial message transmission is to an intermediary system.
Indicates where the message should be routed to.

comments.value: The id may be a non-resolvable URI for systems that do not use standard network-based addresses.

map.value: MSH-25-receiving network address (or MSH-6-receiving facility by implication)

short.value: The source of the data entry

formal.value: The person or device that performed the data entry leading to this message. Where there is more than one candidate, pick the most proximal to the message. Can provide other enterers in extensions.

comments.value: Usually only for the request, but can be used in a response.

map.value: EVN-5-operator ID / ORC-10-entered by / PRT-5-Participation Person:PRT-4-Participation='EP' / ROL where ROL.3 is EP or ORC.10

unique(./controlAct[classCode="CACT" and classCode="EVN" and isNormalAct()]/participation[typeCode="ENT" and isNormalParticipation]/role[classCode="ASSIGNED" and isNormalRole()]/player[isNormalEntity() and classCode=("DEV", "PSN") and determinerCode="INST"])

formal.value: The logical author of the message - the person or device that decided the described event should happen. Where there is more than one candidate, pick the most proximal to the MessageHeader. Can provide other authors in extensions.

comments.value: Usually only for the request, but can be used in a response.

map.value: ORC-19-action by / PRT-5-Participation Person:PRT-4-Participation='AUT' / ROL where ROL.3 is IP or ORC.12

unique(./controlAct[classCode="CACT" and classCode="EVN" and isNormalAct()]/participation[isHighest(priorityCode) and typeCode="AUT" and isNormalParticipation]/role[classCode="ASSIGNED" and isNormalRole()]/player[isNormalEntity() and classCode=("DEV", "PSN") and determinerCode="INST"])

formal.value: Allows data conveyed by a message to be addressed to a particular person or department when routing to a specific application isn't sufficient.

map.value: Not directly supported. Could be shared using attentionLine.value with an appropriate keyWordText

formal.value: The person or organization that accepts overall responsibility for the contents of the message. The implication is that the message event happened under the policies of the responsible party.

comments.value: Usually only for the request, but can be used in a response.

map.value: ORC-12-ordering provider / PRT-5-Participation Person:PRT-4-Participation='OP' / PRT-8-Participation Organization:PRT-4-Participation='OP' / ROL where ROL.3 is RO or ORC.11

unique(./controlAct[classCode="CACT" and classCode="EVN" and isNormalAct()]/participation[isHighest(priorityCode) and typeCode="RESP" and isNormalParticipation]/role[classCode="ASSIGNED" and isNormalRole()]/player[isNormalEntity() and classCode="PSN" and determinerCode="INST"] or ./controlAct[classCode="CACT" and classCode="EVN" and isNormalAct()]/participation[isHighest(priorityCode) and typeCode="RESP" and isNormalParticipation]/role[classCode="ASSIGNED" and isNormalRole()]/scoper[isNormalEntity() and classCode="ORG" and determinerCode="INST"])

formal.value: Coded indication of the cause for the event - indicates a reason for the occurance of the event that is a focus of this message.

map.value: EVN.4 / ORC.16 / OBR-31-reason for study / BPO-13-BP indication for use / RXO-20-indication / RXE-27-give indication / RXD-21-indication / RXG-22-indication / RXA-19-indication

short.value: The actual content of the message

formal.value: The actual data of the message - a reference to the root/focus class of the event.

comments.value: The data is defined where the transaction type is defined. The transaction data is always included in the bundle that is the full message. Only the root resource is specified. The resources it references should be contained in the bundle but are not also listed here. Multiple repetitions are allowed to cater for merges and other situations with multiple focal targets.

map.value: unique(./controlAct[classCode="CACT" and classCode="EVN" and isNormalAct()]/participation[typeCode="SUBJ" and isNormalParticipation]/role or ./controlAct[classCode="CACT" and classCode="EVN" and isNormalAct()]/outboundRelationship[typeCode="SBJ" and isNormalActRelatoinship]/target)

short.value: A resource that describes a message that is exchanged between systems

formal.value: The header for a message exchange that is either requesting or responding to an action. The resource(s) that are the subject of the action as well as other Information related to the action are typically transmitted in a bundle in which the MessageHeader resource instance is the first resource in the bundle.
The identifier of this message.

comments.value: This SHALL be unique within the scope of this stream of messages.

short.value: Time that the message was sent

formal.value: The time that the message was sent.

short.value: Code for the event this message represents

formal.value: Code that identifies the event this message represents and connects it with it's definition. Events defined as part of the FHIR specification have the system value "http://hl7.org/fhir/message-type".

description.value: One of the message events defined as part of FHIR

short.value: If this is a reply to prior message

formal.value: Information about the message that this message is a response to. Only present if this message is a response.
The id of the message that this message is a response to.
Code that identifies the type of response to the message - whether it was successful or not, and whether it should be resent or not.

comments.value: This is a generic response to the request message. Specific data for the response will be found in MessageHeader.data.

description.value: The kind of response to a message

formal.value: Full details of any issues found in the message.

comments.value: This SHALL be contained in the bundle. If any of the issues are errors, the response code SHALL be an error.

formal.value: The source application from which this message originated.
Human-readable name for the target system.

short.value: Name of software running the system

formal.value: May include configuration or other information useful in debugging.
Can convey versions of multiple systems in situations where a message passes through multiple hands.

map.value: SFT-2-software certified version or release number

formal.value: An e-mail, phone, website or other contact point to use to resolve issues with message communications.

map.value: unique(./entity[determinerCode="INST" and classCode="DEV"]/scopesRole[normalRole() and classCode="CON" and layer[classCode="PSN"]/telecom[isNormalDatatype()])

short.value: Actual message source address or id

formal.value: Identifies the routing target to send acknowledgements to.

comments.value: The id may be a non-resolvable URI for systems that do not use standard network-based addresses.

formal.value: The destination application which the message is intended for.

comments.value: there SHOULD be at least one destination, but in some circumstances, the source system is unaware of any particular destination system.

formal.value: Human-readable name for the source system.

short.value: Particular delivery destination within the destination

formal.value: Identifies the target end system in situations where the initial message transmission is to an intermediary system.
Indicates where the message should be routed to.

comments.value: The id may be a non-resolvable URI for systems that do not use standard network-based addresses.

map.value: MSH-25-receiving network address (or MSH-6-receiving facility by implication)

short.value: The source of the data entry

formal.value: The person or device that performed the data entry leading to this message. Where there is more than one candidate, pick the most proximal to the message. Can provide other enterers in extensions.

comments.value: Usually only for the request, but can be used in a response.

map.value: EVN-5-operator ID / ORC-10-entered by / PRT-5-Participation Person:PRT-4-Participation='EP' / ROL where ROL.3 is EP or ORC.10

unique(./controlAct[classCode="CACT" and classCode="EVN" and isNormalAct()]/participation[typeCode="ENT" and isNormalParticipation]/role[classCode="ASSIGNED" and isNormalRole()]/player[isNormalEntity() and classCode=("DEV", "PSN") and determinerCode="INST"])

formal.value: The logical author of the message - the person or device that decided the described event should happen. Where there is more than one candidate, pick the most proximal to the MessageHeader. Can provide other authors in extensions.

comments.value: Usually only for the request, but can be used in a response.

map.value: ORC-19-action by / PRT-5-Participation Person:PRT-4-Participation='AUT' / ROL where ROL.3 is IP or ORC.12

unique(./controlAct[classCode="CACT" and classCode="EVN" and isNormalAct()]/participation[isHighest(priorityCode) and typeCode="AUT" and isNormalParticipation]/role[classCode="ASSIGNED" and isNormalRole()]/player[isNormalEntity() and classCode=("DEV", "PSN") and determinerCode="INST"])

formal.value: Allows data conveyed by a message to be addressed to a particular person or department when routing to a specific application isn't sufficient.

map.value: Not directly supported. Could be shared using attentionLine.value with an appropriate keyWordText

formal.value: The person or organization that accepts overall responsibility for the contents of the message. The implication is that the message event happened under the policies of the responsible party.

comments.value: Usually only for the request, but can be used in a response.

map.value: ORC-12-ordering provider / PRT-5-Participation Person:PRT-4-Participation='OP' / PRT-8-Participation Organization:PRT-4-Participation='OP' / ROL where ROL.3 is RO or ORC.11

unique(./controlAct[classCode="CACT" and classCode="EVN" and isNormalAct()]/participation[isHighest(priorityCode) and typeCode="RESP" and isNormalParticipation]/role[classCode="ASSIGNED" and isNormalRole()]/player[isNormalEntity() and classCode="PSN" and determinerCode="INST"] or ./controlAct[classCode="CACT" and classCode="EVN" and isNormalAct()]/participation[isHighest(priorityCode) and typeCode="RESP" and isNormalParticipation]/role[classCode="ASSIGNED" and isNormalRole()]/scoper[isNormalEntity() and classCode="ORG" and determinerCode="INST"])

formal.value: Coded indication of the cause for the event - indicates a reason for the occurance of the event that is a focus of this message.

map.value: EVN.4 / ORC.16 / OBR-31-reason for study / BPO-13-BP indication for use / RXO-20-indication / RXE-27-give indication / RXD-21-indication / RXG-22-indication / RXA-19-indication

short.value: The actual content of the message

formal.value: The actual data of the message - a reference to the root/focus class of the event.

comments.value: The data is defined where the transaction type is defined. The transaction data is always included in the bundle that is the full message. Only the root resource is specified. The resources it references should be contained in the bundle but are not also listed here. Multiple repetitions are allowed to cater for merges and other situations with multiple focal targets.

map.value: unique(./controlAct[classCode="CACT" and classCode="EVN" and isNormalAct()]/participation[typeCode="SUBJ" and isNormalParticipation]/role or ./controlAct[classCode="CACT" and classCode="EVN" and isNormalAct()]/outboundRelationship[typeCode="SBJ" and isNormalActRelatoinship]/target)

documentation.value: The logical resource id associated with the resource (must be supported by all servers)
The stated language of the resource
